intro: Polypompholyx endlicheri, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of eastern Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in rocky or mountainous regions. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are often pink or white in color. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a hairy texture. It plays an important ecological role in its native habitat by providing nectar for pollinators and shelter for small animals.
